sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hamas releases 17 more hostages to the Red Cross in exchange for 39 Palestinian prisoners held in Israeli jails.

sentences.sentence: Russia claims to have shot down two missiles over the Sea of Azov and more than 20 drones in an attack by Ukraine targeting several regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: France wins the junior version of the Eurovision Song Contest for the second year in a row with Zoe Closier's song Heart.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hamas has released 17 more hostages to the Red Cross in exchange for 39 Palestinian prisoners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: 13 of the hostages are Israelis and 9 of them are children.

sentences.sentence: Three are Thai nationals and one is Russian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Three are Thai nationals and one is Russian.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Israel's prison service said it had released the 39 Palestinians as part of the four-day truce agreement between Israel and Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: International mediators led by the US, Qatar and Egypt are trying to extend the ceasefire, which Hamas later stated that it also wanted to do by releasing more hostages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The existing truce agrees to have 50 Israeli hostages released in exchange for 150 Palestinian prisoners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, at least 128 trucks crossed from Egypt to Gaza on Sunday, including two fuel trucks and two with gas for cooking, Egypt said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Israel's bombardment has driven three-quarters of the population from their homes and flattened many residential areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Visiting Gaza on Saturday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, Israel will continue until the end. Nothing will stop us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Hamas' armed wing, meanwhile, confirmed that four of its senior commanders had been killed. In the occupied West Bank, Israeli soldiers shot dead six Palestinians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: One of them a minor, according to the Palestinian Health Ministry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Since the war began, 239 Palestinians have been killed in the West Bank.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Gaza, more than 13,300 Palestinians have been killed. The Sea of Azov, connected to the Black Sea by a

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: narrow strait. This is where Russia claims it shot down two Ukrainian surface-to-air missiles that had been adapted to hit land targets. It also says it thwarted a drone attack, shooting down more than 20 of them over Moscow and the regions of Bryansk, Smolensk and Tula.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: An air raid alert sounded in annexed Crimea in the south, and the Kerch Bridge was closed for a while.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Officials said one person was injured in Tula when one of the intercepted drones crashed into an apartment building.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: During the night, Russia launched nine kamikaze drones across Ukraine, eight of which Kyiv says were shot down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This comes a day after it said the capital experienced the largest Russian drone attack since the start of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: With winter weather settling in, both sides are looking to take ground that could be springboards for future advances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Snowstorms have hit Romania, Bulgaria, Serbia and Moldova after Cyclone Bettina formed over the Black Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Moldova, two people died in road accidents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And a red alert for bad weather remains in place in four eastern counties in neighbouring Romania, two of them on the Black Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Red weather alerts were also issued for four regions in northeastern Bulgaria due to both the snow and the high winds. And the centre and the west of the country were also hit by snowstorms. It was a similar story in Serbia, where roads became impassable in the west and high winds brought down trees and power lines. In Italy, one woman died after a tree brought down by the high winds fell on top of her as she was walking along the pavement in Rome. Over 300 trees and branches came down in the city and six people were injured. One tree fell onto a children's playground at midday on Saturday, but fortunately no one was hurt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While air quality in Europe is improving, pollution levels are still too high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's the warning issued by the European Environment Agency in a report published Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It points out that all 27 EU member states are failing to meet their own standards, let alone those set by the World Health Organization, and that it's threatening the health of Europeans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There are, of course, many different air pollutants, but I picked the one that is most severe and most harmful, fine particles. And we have our latest estimations is that 253,000 deaths can be attributed to this pollutant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And these, indeed, could be prevented by right measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: MALCOLM BRABANT, The number of deaths linked to fine particles fell by 41 percent between 2005 and 2021, but the Environment Agency says member states must continue their efforts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Nitrogen dioxide pollution was responsible for 52,000 deaths, and short-term exposure to ozone gas is responsible for 22,000 deaths in the E.U.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In cities, transport is the main source of pollution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in some regions, domestic heating using solid fuels like coal or wood also affects air quality. All of these cumulative phenomena can cause or exacerbate illness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: SILVIA KUCHINI, In the most severe cases, it causes illnesses which lead quite quickly to death, lung cancer as an example. But it is also important to note that our report is now first time looking more in detail into various diseases and what is the impact of air pollution to aggravate these diseases like asthma or chronic heart conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So it is the quality of life is in many ways is hampered by air pollution still today in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The European Environment Agency also says that climate change, in particular the increase of temperatures in cities, threatens air quality and as a result the health of all Europeans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The amnesty deal that Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez has proposed means that the question of independence for Catalonia is now central to Spanish politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It would mean former Catalan regional president Carles Puigdemont, who is currently a fugitive from Spanish law and exiled in Brussels, could return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: So what does the EU think?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Well, it's told Spain it's an internal matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is and remains an internal matter for Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thank you very much.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Más allá del debate en las instituciones y el recorrido que pueda tener en los tribunales, la pugna aquí entre españolistas e independentistas catalanes es conquistar la mente y los corazones de la opinión pública europea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: De ello dependerán en gran medida sus futuras aspiraciones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: La EU puede estar clara en dónde se encuentra, pero ¿se cambiará?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Especialmente en el rato de las elecciones europeas en junio.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hay una batalla por el relato, eso es así.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Y hay unas elecciones europeas a la vuelta de la esquina. Por tanto, ¿el terreno de juego se va a mover hacia Bruselas? Muy probablemente sí, será así. ¿Eso va a tener algún efecto por parte de las instituciones europeas? Ninguno, absolutamente ninguno. priority is to put independence front and center of European politics, even when there are more pressing issues for the EU to address. The priorities of this president have been very clear, which is to put Catalonia once again at the forefront of the European agenda. And this has been one of our priorities to make sure that our message is clear, which is that this is a political conflict. And now we begin the second part of our political negotiation, which is the fact that Catalans want to decide their own future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But with the EU trying to stop the rise of the far right in Europe, debates over independence for Catalonia or Corsica or Flanders couldn't be less welcome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And within Spain, the centre-right People's Party and the far-right Vox Party angrily reject Catalan independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The holiday season has begun in Berlin, and this year the main zoo is celebrating by turning itself into a Christmas garden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Visitors can walk along a two-kilometre route illuminated by festive lights and music.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The centrepiece, an illuminated castle that's more than 400 years old. And this year, the zoo is showcasing a jungle theme. But you can get more out of this than simply hot chocolate and sweets. Studies have shown a wide range of benefits for people connecting to the natural world. And one environmental psychologist says it's proven to make people happier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It helps you restore all the resources you need like to process information, to make decisions, and positive effects on your mood.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It makes you more calm and relaxing, yeah, in a joyful and positive mood.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Research has shown that nature helps people with everything from creativity to productivity. One study found that people who spend time outdoors in the evening are more productive the next day. And it doesn't even have to be real nature.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Depictions of nature have been found to help people as well. I try to think of the value that nature has for us and to establish kind of a human-nature connection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And we tend to forget that we are strongly dependent and interdependent and a part of nature.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Such benefits can be particularly beneficial in the winter months when people tend to stay indoors for longer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And with climate change, some scientists say people getting out into the natural environments around them is more important than ever.
